body.p: Usually when linking to resources outside the documentation, normal web links are used.
There are two aspects to take in consideration when styling them:

ol.li: When printed on paper, show the entire URL, so the user can see it and type it in a browser.
When displayed in a PDF reader, mark it as a link, so the user can click on it.

body.p: Now let's take a short example:
body.codeblock: This is a link to the W3C website.
body.p: To fulfill both conditions, we can add a text after the "W3C" text, with the entire value of the href attribute, and we will use the link or -oxy-link property to mark the generated content as being a link:
